Problem:
Consider a system governed by the partial differential equation \\(\\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = \\nabla^2 u + ku\\), where \\(k\\) is a constant. We explore the impact of a Fourier transformation \\(F(u)\\) applied to the function \\(u(x, t)\\).

Can we deduce the exact initial condition \\(u(x, 0)\\) solely from the Fourier transformed state \\(F(u)(\\xi, T)\\) at time T without knowing whether \\(F(u)\\) was applied at the onset or later?
Explanation: Without knowing whether or when the Fourier transform was applied, the deduced initial conditions can vary because the Fourier transformation can either pre-exist or be part of the evolving equation, impacting the frequency components in ways that are not reversible purely based on the transformed state at T.
